summary: The "Fixing Gaps in Hurricane Preparedness Act" directs the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) to conduct research and development to improve public understanding and response to hurricane forecasts and warnings. The bill mandates a review of existing knowledge, identifies data gaps, and requires research into how various demographics, including vulnerable populations, interpret and act on hurricane information. It includes provisions for pilot studies, economic analyses, and data collection to enhance hurricane preparedness strategies and communication.
